page.title: 01INTRODUCTION MID-WENSLEYDALE
page.content: Our area is in the Yorkshire Dales National Park which covers 680 square miles. It is the third largest National Park after the Lake District and Snowdonia. Our area includes part of Wensleydale and part of Bishopdale. It is an area of outstanding natural beauty and many people come to spend their holidays here enjoying the scenery, walking and sharing the amenities of the countryside. Many local people are involved in tourism but the most important industry is farming. Most farms are hill farms, producing sheep for the meat market and for wool. There are some dairy herds, mostly of Friesian cows, where farms have suitable grazing. Much of the land is upland and of poor quality There is no arable land.Most buildings are of stone. Dry stone walls are a feature of the landscape.
